controls.caption: Path
controls.name: path
controls.description:
Folder for the result data.
Note: it MUST be an absolute path; it will NOT be resolved relative any "current" folder. Also and must not contain "suspicious" characters/substring like % (property?), ${... (variable inside a string?) etc. (excepting starting %TEMP%), because this can probably mean some "property" for further replacement by some functions; it should be a normal usual path.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. So, it is correct to write here
%TEMP%my_file.dat,
%TEMP%/my_file.dat
or (in Windows)
%TEMP%\my_file.dat
.Any other system or executor system properties are not allowed here.

controls.caption: What to do?
controls.name: operation
controls.description:
What to do with the path.
For "check xxx" operations, this function throws exception if there is no existing file or folder (or if we needs a file, but it is a folder, and vice versa).
For "create xxx" operations, this function does nothing if the folder or file, requested to create, already exists.
Note: 3 operations with parent folder (check existence, create parent, create all parents) do nothing if the specified path has no parents, i.e. if it is a root folder.

items.caption: check, if the path specifies existing folder
check existence of parent folder of the specified path
create parent folder of specified folder
create all parents of specified folder

controls.caption: Secure mode
controls.name: secure
controls.description: If set, Java system properties in the path are disabled, and the path is checked that it does not contain "suspicious" characters/substring like % (property?), ${... (variable inside a string?). Executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}" and starting %TEMP%/ are enabled.
